body.p:
Quartermaster's Department,
OFFICE RIVER TRANSPORTATION,
Louisville, Ky, August 24" 1864.
To His excellency
Thomas E Bramlette.
Governor of the State of Kentucky.

The undersigned would respectfully ask of your excellency an appointment of Notary Public. for and in the County of Jefferson and State of Kentucky in place of J H Metcalf who has removed from this County and department to which I am attached.

Henry L Driver
Clerk for Capt Frank Ernst
Q. M. of River Transportation
Louisville Ky.

Jefferson Co
Notary Public
Henry L. Driver
apptd
26th Aug/64

Office River Tranportation
Augt 24th/64
To Governor Bramlette

I would respectfully request the appointment of Henry L. Driver as Notary Public -- he being employed in my office the interest of the Goverment would be promoted by having a Notary in the Office to attend to taking affidavits for L. B. while under charter --

Vy Respectfully
Your obt Servant
Frank R. Ernst
Capt & a. q. m
In charge River Transportation
